lead_paragraph: An independent panel examining a notorious California prison has found that the use of deadly force was unjustified in the majority of cases and denounced the procedures for investigating prison violence. Of the 31 fatal or serious shootings that were reviewed, at Corcoran State Prison from 1989 to 1995, 24 were found to involve the unjustified use of deadly force, the three-member panel concluded in its report released Wednesday.
abstract: Independent panel probing 31 fatal or serious shootings of prisoners at California's Corcoran State Prison finds 24 involved unjustified use of dealy force; scores procedures for investigating prison violence (S)

headline.main: Panel Assails Prison For Excessive Force
